inn1.comm: 133 kph, gets a little away swing straightaway as this length ball is defended to the off side
134 kph, fended away off the back foot as he wards off the swing
137 kph, sensibly leaves this next one delivered wider outside off
135 kph, outswinger on a fullish length which is allowed through outside off
133 kph, another one which is left by the batsman as he shortens the length a touch
132 kph, has a flash at this slightly wide delivery outside off but is late on it as Sri Lanka begin with a maiden
135 kph, looks to get down the track as he drove this length ball on the up, but straight to the mid off fielder

138 kph, what a catch from Perera! Brendon is gone! Huge wicket for the Sri Lankans! Brendon dances down the track as he looks to clobber Prasad through the covers, and that too just second ball. Ends up miscuing this high over long off, with the fielder having to run behind to take the catch as he fell over in his attempt to balance
136 kph, angling in on the pads as Guptill fends it away
137 kph, struck straight back to the bowler as Guptill continues to search for his timing
137 kph, just about squirts away this almost yorker-length outside his off stump in front of point to pickup a couple
139 kph, turned away off the back foot as he locates the mid on fielder
136 kph, outswinger on a fifth stump line which deviates away from the batsman upon pitching on a length
135 kph, gets good carry off the deck to this shorter one which rears up nastily on Kane, who is able to weave away out of its path
132 kph, once again allowed to go through to the keeper by the batsman
136 kph, has found a good line here as he gets this to just nip away from outside off, with Kane looking to glide this before playing inside of the line
137 kph, the added bounce may have just saved Kane there as he goes after this short of a length outside his off stump, with the ball bouncing just over the outside edge of his bat
133 kph, this time is able to get it away off the back foot with a superbly timed back-foot punch through the covers

140 kph, the pace is good, but the ball not quite. Ends up slipping a leg-side delivery which is tickled fine by Guptill to find the fine leg boundary. That will be gratefully received by Gups, who is looking to bat himself into some form
139 kph, pitches it up fuller on middle and leg as this is lasered straight to the man at mid on

139 kph, this looked as plumb as it gets. Prasad gets movement into the pads from a fullish length as it strikes just in front of middle and off. Prasad goes up for the appeal but the umpire, bizzarely, doesn't seem moved. They ask for the DRS, but unbelievably, that is not available. This is a first for me. It really did look out to the naked eye. Very lucky break for the hosts here
138 kph, defended away by the batsman
140 kph, defended away off the back foot as he shuffles over to protect his stumps
140 kph, able to use his height effectively there to get on top of this just back of a length on middle and leg
137 kph, slapped away off the back foot, but straight to point
134 kph, shifts his weight onto the back foot as he punches this down towards extra-cover, running the first one hard to complete two as the Dunedin crowd applauds the effort
135 kph, defends inside of the line of this just back of a length outside off
135 kph, parries this back of a length outside off towards the close-in fielder
134 kph, locates the fielder on the off side as he dead-batted this length ball away
133 kph, shorter ball in the same channel which Guptill attacks as he produces an uppish punch in the direction of the short cover fielder, but the ball dies just before
141 kph, solidly drives this fullish length outside off to the long off fielder
137 kph, drilled hard to the short cover fielder as he is able to get behind the ball
140 kph, delivers a bouncer which rushes Guptill into a rash hook through fine leg, which he just about manages to get away
140 kph, Prasad goes for the shout as he strikes Kane on the thigh pads, but this was definitely too high, and probably going down leg too
137 kph, gets struck around the thigh area as well as Kane grimaces in pain
141 kph, down on one knee as he uncorks a drive straight at the short cover fielder
136 kph, fuller one just outside off as Williamson is late on the drive
136 kph, punched away through backward point as they run the single
135 kph, defended away off the back foot and with soft hands
137 kph, looks to run this one behind square, but finds backward point
132 kph, straying on the pads as this is helped down towards backward square leg
135 kph, fended away off the back food in the general vicinity of point
140 kph, fuller length ball on middle and leg which is driven on the up through long on as mid on is unable to get enough behind it to stop the ball from going to the boundary
144 kph, rocks forward to play this with soft hands towards point
142 kph, drills this fuller one straight back at the bowler, who is able to offer a hand in his follow through
140 kph, angling on the pads as this is clipped efficiently through cow corner to find another useful boundary for the hosts
140 kph, defended with a nice, straight bat as he shifts onto the back foot
143 kph, nicely behind this back of a length as Kane plays with soft hands to the off side
138 kph, length on middle and leg which is driven straight to long on
134 kph, defended away this time towards the off side
132 kph, is late on this bouncer from Lakmal as the umpire takes a little time before deciding this is a wide
136 kph, great reply as he delivers one just outside off which Guptill looked to force away through long off, with the swing nipping away from the outside edge as he brought the downswing
132 kph, this time steered towards the direction of mid off
135 kph, sees the line going down the leg side so he shuffles just a touch to the off stump before flicking this high over backward square to find the boundary

136 kph, nicely on top of the bounce as he drills this back to the bowler, who fields the ball in his follow through as he collapses onto the pitch, then fires in a throw at the striker's end when he sees him out of his ground. Able to get back into his crease though
138 kph, onto the back foot as this is turned away to the leg side
138 kph, able to open the face to this back of a length outside as he gets a single just behind square

141 kph, this beats everyone on its way to the fine leg boundary as Prasad gets appreciable movement both in the air and off the pitch as Guptill is cut up, with Sangakkara also failing to get to it despite putting in a low dive to his left
140 kph, yorker-length just outside off which is dug out towards the mid off fielder
141 kph, waits on the back foot as this is directed away through mid on
141 kph, plays his characteristic Guptill plant-my-foot-and-lift-bowler-high-over-long off stroke which he doesn't quite time as the ball lands at the extra-cover boundary after a couple of bounces
defended from the crease to this one which turns into him
uses his feet to get this one down to long on
able to force away a shot through the covers to pickup a single
gets nicely back before punching this one straight back to the bowler
advances down as he looks to heave this one pitched outside off, with the ball ending up closer to deep midwicket
gets down the track to mitigate the turn

130 kph, Perera strikes right away, or did he? Sangakkara completes a low take to this just back of a length which catches the outside of Guptill's bat, with the ball looking to have died on the SL keeper. No one quite sure what has happened here as they go to the replay. It really is touch and go as it doesn't appear to have carried all the way, and the umpire confirms it as the decision remains not out
129 kph, Guptill rocks back to pull this powerfully through midwicket to rub some salt into Perera's fresh wound
132 kph, lifts Perera straight over his head as he doesn't middle it at all, but the ball ends up falling safe somewhere between the converging paths of long on and long off
129 kph, looks for the drop single on the off side as this rolls to mid off, with the fielder firing in a throw which is not backed up, affording NZ an extra run
133 kph, waits on this before helping it down to deep fine leg to end the over
drills back this delivery on and around middle to the bowler, who is unable to field the ball despite putting in the dive
good use of the feet to chip the spinner over extra-cover, with the fielder stationed near there looking to have cut it off, but he was in contact of the rope
waits in his crease as he fends this away towards the leg side
tries to whip this one away on the leg side, but to no avail
tries to find the gap through the covers, but is thwarted in his effort
ends the over with a controlled steer down to long on
133 kph, looking to glide this away through the vacant space behind square, but doesn't quite get it away
132 kph, this time gets the result he sought, albeit a touch squarer as third man comes round
130 kph, eased down to long on, but no run on offer

129 kph, gets this to nip back from a length outside off as he is struck on the top of his front pad. May have got an inside-edge as the ball continued on to brush the thigh pad before finding its way to the keeper. Didn't look that affected by it, but he will have to go as the umpire reverses the decision
gets off the mark as he gets bat on this back of a length before playing it with soft hands to the off side to run the single
Kane in control of this glide as he rose up to meet the ball, with the ball continuing on to the third man fielder

dropped Kane pops a straightforward chance to Dilshan at short cover, who ends up bobbling the chance as he leapt up to get at it, probably because it was too easy for his liking. Regulation chance which should have been taken as SL may come to rue that
gropes forward before defending away to the off side
this time looks to get down the track, but ends up hitting straight back to the bowler
brings the bat down as this is deflected away to the off side
onto the back foot as he looks to get this away through the leg side
picks up a single behind square on the leg side to retain the strike
129 kph, helped off the back foot down to fine leg for a single
131 kph, goes after this short ball outside off as he slices this away high over third man, with the fielder in the deep stopping the ball
130 kph, fended away towards the off side
131 kph, on the back foot again as this is played away with soft hands
130 kph, back of a length on middle and leg which is tucked away to the leg side
130 kph, eased away off the back foot to midwicket to pickup a single
driven firmly by Taylor towards long off
defended away as he lunges forward
waits on the back foot to this one which slides on around off as he just gets it away
gets away a single to the fielder at long off
once again on the front foot by Taylor
width afforded with this fuller one as Taylor drills this straight to deep extra-cover
130 kph, surprises him with a shorter one which Taylor just about gets away, albeit awkwardly
130 kph, short and wide and treated with utter disdain as Williamson pulls this through midwicket in no time
130 kph, works a single away through midwicket to get Taylor back on strike
133 kph, leans into a crisp drive through the covers as this races away to the boundary. Taylor's confidence will be helped with that stroke
132 kph, elects to duck under this shorter one from the bowler
129 kph, solid connection of the bat as Taylor went into the pull, but finds the boundary rider at midwicket
just about steers away this Herath special outside off
struck back towards the bowler as he fails to pick his gap on the leg side
uncorks a drive through the covers this time, but Dilshan lands on top of this like a cat
this time going down leg as Taylor is late on it
once again defended back to the bowler by the batsman
tries to steer this past Herath, but the bowler is right behind it as achieves a maiden
130 kph, fullish length which is driven to the fielder at mid off
129 kph, helped away off the pads through backward square for an easy single
130 kph, gets slightly forward as he steers this away through the off side
129 kph, tries to glide this one away through the point region, but locates the fielder
132 kph, fortunate to not have chopped this onto the stumps as the ball just bounces over
127 kph, opens the face to run this down to third man to keep the strike
eases away this one pitched outside off to long off
gets this to spin away upon pitching as Ross ends up getting this away to point
tries to find the gap on the leg side now, but doesn't quite time it so
this time succeeds in his endeavour to get away Mendis to long on
shifts his weight onto the back foot as he punches this down to long off
driven off the back foot to the cover fielders, with the pair able to complete a single before the throw
fuller one on the pads which is flicked away to deep fine leg
132 kph, fires in a yorker which is dug out successfully by Williamson
134 kph, works with the angle to help this down to deep midwicket
133 kph, gets forward before flicking this away through backward square
134 kph, able to glide this one away to the third man fielder
136 kph, yorker which is turned into a low full toss as this is worked away round the corner to deep fine leg
Taylor fails to drive Mendis through the covers as the ball spins away
this time picks up a single through cover to get off strike
employs the sweep to good effect, but finds square leg
advances down the track before squirting this one away through the leg side. The non-striker has to race hard to the other end as a throw is delivered from the close-in field, but ends up being safe
lifts Mendis high over extra-cover as Chandimal is unable to stop the ball from reaching the boundary
goes down the track before drilling this straight to mid off
135 kph, fantastic shot this from Kane. Able to use the angle of the delivery down the pads to lift this high over fine leg to get the first six of his innings
135 kph, this time cuts it away off the back foot through point
134 kph, sensibly weaves out of the path of this length ball outside off
133 kph, cut away hard through the backward point region as the boundary rider cuts it off before the rope
134 kph, gets squared up slightly by this length on middle and off as the ball squirts away to the off side
133 kph, full and on the pads as this is clipped away through midwicket. Also earns another fifty as his fine form continues
defended away to the off side with soft hands
eased away down to long on for a single
helped again to the same region, this time by Kane
Taylor rotates the strike now as he finds the man at long on once more
drops this a touch short as he shifts the line to middle and leg, with Kane pulling this hard to midwicket for a well-ran brace
has to poke out and get away this Mendis delivery down the leg side
run away outside off through the third man region for one
directed straight back to the bowler by Taylor
looking to shuffle over and turn this through cow corner, which he does
steered away from the crease to long on
gets forward to clip this away through midwicket
Williamson is in some really splendid form indeed as he picksup this fuller one outside off and then proceeds to cart it high over cow corner for another six
eases away a single through the leg side
looks to force one away through the covers, but finds the fielder
shimmies down before hitting this one straight to mid on
steered away authoritatively to the off side
this time tries to get it away through backward point
ends the over with a flighted delivery which is defended by the batsman
doesn't get the line right as this is tickled down to the fine leg boundary
drives at this fuller one rather uppishly as the ball goes towards the cover fielder
also inside-edges this wide yorker which he ends up inside-edging onto his pads
defended away with the softest of hands to the off side
waits on this one before gliding it fine through third man
puched away off the back foot through extra-cover to end the over
manages to get the boundary just behind square on the leg side as he sweeps this low full toss all along the ground
reaches back to try and cut this late through backward point
steered expertly by Taylor to the fielder at long off
short from the bowler as Kane is given room to cart this through cow corner to pickup a boundary
just about manages to squirt this one away through the off side for a well-executed drop single
driven firmly to long off to end the over
middle and leg, Williamson leans forward and nudges it to deep mid-wicket
shortish and just outside off, Taylor cuts it towards third man
shortish and plenty of width on offer, Williamson jumps up and slashes a cut towards third man, a better throw or if the bowler had gone back to the stumps, then Taylor would have been in trouble
short and outside off, Williamson cut away square of the wicket on the off-side
dug in mid-way down the wicket, Taylor takes it on, pulls it off the top-edge and the ball flies away to fine leg, the fielder was square and had no chance of stopping that
opens the face a touch to help this just behind square on the off side
tucked away through the leg side for a single
looks to advance down before adjusting the shot to ease this down to long on
clips away this leg-side slanting delivery
looks to whip away Dilshan through midwicket as a slip from the other end only keeps them to the single
turned away on middle and leg just behind square to bring up the 100-run stand between these two. Polite applause across the ground after the announcement was made
good use of the feet to scythe away Dilshan through the covers, but the short cover fielder is able to take most of the sting from the ball
131 kph, Kane just clobbers this back of a length back over Perera's head to find the straight boundary
131 kph, this time steers it away through extra-cover to bring Ross on strike
130 kph, tries to slice away Perera through backward point, but Dilshan makes an excellent leaping dive high to his right to stop this in its tracks. Vintage Dilly there
130 kph, Dilshan into the mix once more as Taylor tries to scythe away through the same region, with Dilshan offering up a hand to take most of the pace from it
130 kph, waits on the back foot before running this to third man
132 kph, pulled hard by Taylor, but straight to the boundary rider at deep square leg
strikes this low full toss straight to the silly mid on fielder
this time finds Dilshan in his follow through as Ross looks for the gap
clipped away just behind square to get Williamson back on strike. In the 90s is Kane
advances down before adjusting his stroke at the last moment to defend this away
short from the bowler as Kane picks his gap through midwicket, with the boundary rider putting in a valiant dive to cut this off
uses his feet to get to the pitch before drilling this straight to short cover, who bobbles it the first time before recovering soon after
Williamson able to get the spinner away on the leg side to move to 95
gets down the track before clipping this softly through midwicket
dead-batted away to the off side by Williamson
looked to get to the pitch of the ball to drive, but ends up inside-edging onto his body and to the leg side
waits outside his off stump before running this through third man for a single
reaches out to dead-bat this one back towards the bowler

gets down for the paddle sweep as he looks for the gap through backward square. Williamson wants two right away, but Taylor is guilty of ball watching as he has his back turned to his partner, and doesn't see how he has come all the way down to his end before deciding to go back. Sangakkara receives the throw from the deep before rattling away a throw at the non-striker's which connects. A really unlucky way for Williamson to go as he badly deserved this hundred. Big wicket for SL there
tickled down the leg side by Taylor for a couple
steers this next one down to long off to get Corey on strike
waits on the back foot before glancing this away to midwicket
Taylor gets to his fifty with a nudge away to the leg side. Will need to put the Kane dismissal out of his mind here and kick on
fended away by Anderson to the off side to end a successful over for Sri Lanka
directed away off the front foot down to the man at long on
targets middle and leg as this is swept competently through backward square by Anderson for a brace
this time times it better, but squarer as he finds the boundary rider
reaches out to this shorter one as he turns it away to the leg side
able to successfully dig out this delivery at yorker-length on middle and leg
thrown up in the slot by Herath as Taylor unfurls a corker of a drive which just bullets to the extra-cover boundary
139 kph, cut away powerfully in front of square, but can't get it to the rope
143 kph, this one came out wrong from the belt as a full toss is failed to be punished by Taylor, who looked rather surprise by the end product
142 kph, gets this to bounce appreciably from a length as Taylor gets on top of it
140 kph, short and wide and Taylor metes out the appropriate punishment as this is cut away fiercely through backward point
144 kph, rides on top of this just back of a length as the ball is directed away to point
140 kph, short and width on offer and Taylor after 60-odd to his name is not going to miss out. Four runs square off the wicket for NZ
133 kph, fuller one on the pads which is flicked away to the leg side
135 kph, squirts away this fuller one outside off past a sprawling point to the boundary rider at third man, who puts in the sliding dive to cut it off before the rope
132 kph, full and once again targeting the pads as this is eased away to cow corner

132 kph, looks to shovel this full toss outside off through midwicket, with the fielder on the leg side firing in a throw at the non-striker's after Taylor refused the single. Would have been disaster if Anderson was short of his ground
132 kph, slices away Perera through cover to find the man stationed before the boundary
134 kph, another full toss which Perera doesn't quite get right, but Anderson unable to middle it as he finds mid off
137 kph, goes round the wicket to Taylor as this is fended away to the off side off the back foot
141 kph, well down the leg side now as they weren't even in the same time zone
138 kph, full and on the pads as this is struck in the direction of mid on, who is able to get a hand on it
142 kph, drilled straight at the short cover fielder, who puts in a good diving stop
141 kph, wide yorker which is lasered to the man at long off
140 kph, gets a leading edge to this leg-side delivery as he intented to get it away behind square, but instead the ball lobs up high over extra-cover, where it lands safely in no-mans land
142 kph, full delivery which pitches outside leg before striking the front pad of Anderson. End up running a leg-bye regardless
131 kph, looking for the yorker but offers up a low full toss which Taylor is able to slice away through backward point to find the boundary
130 kph, slips one well wide of off as the umpire swivels to signal the scorer
131 kph, hits through the line as he takes this fuller delivery pitched outside off and strikes it more towards mid on
132 kph, yet another low full toss which is doled the proper punishment as Anderson whips this away efficiently off the pads to find the backward square boundary in a hurry
133 kph, Perera bowling to a plan as he continues to operate in the same area, except this time it is a truly leg-side delivery, which is called wide by the umpire
130 kph, short on the same channel and Anderson sees this early as he pulls this hard through midwicket to get the third boundary of the over. Turning out to be a useful over for NZ
131 kph, late on this length ball as he ends up hitting it in the direction of the bowler
130 kph, brings up the fourth four in the over with another leg-side delivery which is tickled by the batsman through fine leg, beating a despairing dive from the boundary rider to the rope
defended from the crease before a misfield by silly mid on allows them to sneak the single
bad idea from Dilly. Anderson sees this one early as it is tossed up just outside off, with Anderson bending the knee to heave this high over cow corner to get into the stands
looking to now swivel in his spot and shovel this over backward square, but is late on it
able to drive this one on the up down to long off
eased away by the batsman to the long on fielder
slipped in a fuller length which is dug out in the direction of long on
some improvisation from Ross as he goes for the Dilscoop which he doesn't quite get away as the ball just about gets over the head of Sangakkara

is early on the sweep as this one just rolls behind towards the stumps, and he is lucky for this not to have disturbed timber as the ball stops before his off stump. Looks like they want to go for the review though. Anderson well early into his sweep but this may have just pitched outside leg, so that could hurt SL's chances, and the review confirms this. Decision stands
gets far too early into this lofted sweep as the ball ricochets off the bat onto his helmet before going to the off side
gets it in nice and full as Anderson digs it out
full and on leg stump as this is worked round the corner to deep fine leg
worked away off the back foot, but finds the close-in fielder on the off side
once again looks to force it away past point, but to no avail
141 kph, goes round the wicket to Anderson as he steers this one away through the covers
143 kph, slanting angle from leg which is flicked away behind square to the fielder at fine leg
143 kph, reaches out to this wide yorker but fails to get it away as the ball is chopped on behind low to the keeper
144 kph, Anderson shows off his brute strength with a powerful scythe through the covers as he got down on one knee. Really gave this the beans as the ball powered away to the rope
141 kph, fires in a yorker which gives Anderson just enough to get under as he slogs this away through cow corner to make it consecutive boundaries
141 kph, spoons away another wide yorker, this time square off the wicket on the off side

and Anderson's little cameo comes to an end as he holes out high over cow corner as he looked for another heave through that favoured area of his. Was looking increasingly dangerous as his stay prolonged at the crease
fuller and on the stumps, Taylor eases it to long on
and Ronchi gets away with a boundary through the covers as he seems to have just resumed from the other day. Perhaps he was in 'pause' mode all this time?
this time flicks Herath away behind square on the leg side to get off strike
fails to work away Herath through the leg side as the ball caught the outside edge
this time is able to pinch the single down the leg side to keep strike
Taylor greets Dilshan's third over with a massive blow over cow corner as he shimmied down before smashing this for six
looked to get down before adjusting to defend at the last moment
pitched up and turned away through the leg side as he gets a single
full on the pads as Ronchi swivels to sweep this through fine leg
darted in by Herath on middle and leg as he eases away through midwicket
uses his feet to guide this one down to the fielder at long on
follows the batsman, Ronchi makes room and drives it to long on
able to steer this one outside off through to mid on
excellent fielding from Herath as he gets behind this firmly struck drive from Ronchi
able to paddle the spinner behind square on the leg side before setting off for a quick single. Gets his stumps knocked down at the other end, but he was definitely safe
waltzes down the track before clobbering Herath high over long on for another massive strike. Takes him to within one boundary of a deserved ton. Clean as you like from Ross

almost gets out lbw as he is struck on the pads in an attempt to go for the sweep round the corner. Herath goes for the appeal, but the umpire is not interested. Would have been a fine way to end what has been a good spell from the experienced tweaker

tossed up on middle and leg as Taylor is late on this, looking to tickle this behind through fine leg. Dilshan likes it, and the umpire acquiesces, but Taylor wants a review. Struck him on the toe with nothing on HotSpot either. It is all red so Taylor has to go, and unfortunately for him, he falls just 4 short of his century. Joins Williamson as the other 90-er in the innings
looks to get into the action straightaway as he advances down to try and work away a single through the leg side, but is late on it
backs away to create room before carting away this shorter length through long on
Ronchi looking to lift Dilshan high over long off, with the fielder stationed there for that purpose, but doesn't middle it
Elliott has no choice but to throw his bat at this as he goes for the lofted sweep over midwicket, with the ball just falling short in the deep
tries to get one away on the leg side, but to no avail
142 kph, back of a length around off, Ronchi goes for a wild swing across the line but fails to make contact
143 kph, really wide delivery outside off which is left alone by the batsman
140 kph, delivers yet another one that is even wider as the umpire goes through the motions once more
141 kph, shifts his line a touch closer now as Ronchi is able to get under this fuller length to slice it high over point
140 kph, gets his bat out once more to reach for this as he squirts away in the direction of gully
140 kph, looking to be cheeky as he shuffles over outside off to try and paddle this through fine leg, but gets it away squarer
142 kph, delivers a bouncer which Ronchi is unable to get anything on. Ends up being signaled for height

142 kph, after much trial and error, the plan has come off as Ronchi departs the oval after slicing a wide, full delivery from Prasad over extra-cover, with the fielder able to take the catch comfortably
Elliott able to retain the strike with a chip over the covers
goes round the wicket as Elliott utilises the angle to flick this behind to fine leg for a brace
128 kph, saw this one early enough as he stands his ground before bludgeoning this half-volley through the line to sail high over long on for six
this time carts Perera through cow corner as Vettori is brought onto strike
129 kph, attempted to go after this wide, full delivery from Perera, but the umpire saves him by calling a wide
131 kph, gets his bat out to dead-bat this fuller delivery just outside off as they scamper the run
129 kph, advances down the track before reaching out to slice this full delivery going across him through backward point
129 kph, another yorker converging on middle as Elliott just about manages to get it away on the leg side
140 kph, Elliott gets down on one knee to this half-volley outside off, but fails to get it away as he inside-edges onto the pad
140 kph, in the slot but Elliott unlucky to find the cover fielder as he is held to just one
139 kph, backs away before squirting this fuller one through cover, with the fielder taking off most of the pace as the ball slows up in the deep

117 kph, excellent slow bouncer from Prasad which Vettori was looking to hook but is late on. Elliott guns for his end so Vettori takes the cue, but is short of his ground as Sangakkara scrambles a throw to Prasad, who is able to reach out to knock over the stumps with Vettori short of his ground at the non-striker's
140 kph, cuts this short and wide delivery hard through the covers, but the ball is tracked back before the rope

142 kph, in the zone for the drive which Elliott does, as this one races away through extra-cover. Mills to get back for the second before the throw but is picked off with his bat on the line. Mills has to go as he was at the danger end

inn2.comm: gets this one to tail in as it strikes the pads of Lahiru. Mills goes for the shout, but this is given not out
134 kph, gets this to slant across the batsman as Lahiru shoulders arms
135 kph, sprayed on the pads as this is flicked away behind square
131 kph, elects to leave this one angling away from outside off
136 kph, shifts his line of attack on the pads as Thirimanne tucks it away to the leg side
131 kph, again on the hips as this is eased away down to the square leg boundary off the back foot
133 kph, straightaway gets shape into the batsman from a middle and off stump line as this is played away to the leg side
135 kph, looks to smash through the line of this one curling in from outside off, with the ball rushing past off stump as he played the wrong line
137 kph, defended away off the back foot to the bowler

134 kph, slips one on the pads and shaping away as Dilshan tries to tickle this one fine, but the ball ends up hitting the pad on the way to Ronchi. They appeal for caught behind, but more wishful thinking than anything else
136 kph, and now Dilshan is underway with a swipe through the off side which ends up being miscued more to the leg side
137 kph, goes down the leg side now as the umpire signals to the scorer
131 kph, defends this fullish length to the leg side to end the over
131 kph, tests him out with a bouncer which Dilshan sees early as he hooks this away fine to beat the boundary rider at deep fine leg
132 kph, steered away on the front foot through the off side
140 kph, cranking up the pace as this outswinger is left well alone by the batsman
134 kph, fullish length and swinging away on middle as Dilshan guides this to midwicket
134 kph, is late on this leg-side slanting delivery as it crashes into his thigh pad
133 kph, thrashes away this just back of a length ball through the covers on the up to find the extra-cover boundary. Signature shot that from Dilly
139 kph, operates in the same channel as he pitches one up outside off, which Lahiru leaves alone
139 kph, able to get up and under this length wide of off as Lahiru slices through backward point to find third man
141 kph, this time looks to nurdle away a single through the leg side, but to no avail
139 kph, pushes at this fuller length outside his off stump as Boult induces an outside edge which flies safely past second slip to the third man boundary
136 kph, meets the ball with the full face as this is defended away to the off side
137 kph, excellent line to finish the over as this one nips away upon pitching at just about back of a length, with the batsman playing inside of the line
132 kph, gets nicely behind the line of this length ball on and around off
131 kph, shortens the length a touch as he shifts the line wider of off, with the batsman not at all interested
132 kph, on top of the bounce of this one pitched on middle and leg
132 kph, looks to cut this away past point, but finds the fielder
134 kph, Dilshan living la vida loca here as he follows after this length ball which carries nicely off the deck as it travels through to Ronchi
127 kph, seemed to stop on him as he pushed at this length ball outside off, with the ball ending up in the cover region
135 kph, cramps Dilshan for room as this one shapes in from middle and off at a back of a length
137 kph, slipping onto the pads now as this is helped round the corner to fine leg
140 kph, has a go after this widish length outside off as he fails to make any contact
138 kph, elects to shoulder arms to this one shaping away outside off
139 kph, worked away at the top of the bounce through the leg side by Lahiru
137 kph, ends the over with a back of a length outside off as Ronchi collects from behind
135 kph, good length delivery swinging in on off, Dilshan comes forward and turns it to square leg for a run
135 kph, opens the face to run this through the gully region
133 kph, strikes this length delivery outside off to the short cover fielder
134 kph, slanting down the leg side now as this is worked down to fine leg with the angle on offer
134 kph, jumps on this wide half-volley from Mills as Lahiru frees his arms to blaze away square off the wicket to find the boundary
134 kph, back of a length and going across as Lahiru edges this away intentionally down to third man to retain the strike
138 kph, on top of this back of a length shaping into leg stump
139 kph, waits on the back foot before parrying this away towards the vicinity of point
140 kph, fullish length which Lahiru just about gets away to the off side
138 kph, fuller ball on middle and off which is struck back at the bowler, who fields it in his follow through
138 kph, content to shoulder arms to this length delivery outside off
136 kph, unable to get it off the square as Boult is rewarded for some disciplined bowling
128 kph, gets the line wrong as this slides down leg
130 kph, tries to cut this away square off the wicket but doesn't quite middle it
132 kph, Dilshan given the opportunity to free his arms and much to Mills' detriment, finds the boundary on the off side with a cut behind square
128 kph, straighter from Mills now as this is tickled down to fine leg. Mills tumbles over after delivering that last one, but he seems okay to keep going
128 kph, glances away this length delivery on the pads to backward square, who fumbles the take as they deliberate taking a second, but decide against it
132 kph, right behind the line of this length ball outside his off stump
128 kph, wanted to get a quick single through the off side but slices away a bit too well to the fielder as he is prevented from taking the run
137 kph, able to glide this back of a length through the gully region as a direct hit at the striker's end affords them an extra run
139 kph, slanting on the pads now as this is glanced down to fine leg
135 kph, cramps Dilshan for room as he gets this to shape in from middle
136 kph, gets the line wrong as this slips down the leg side, with Ronchi collecting from behind
135 kph, is late on this inswinging length ball on middle as the ball is inside-edged onto the body
135 kph, pitches it up as he shifts the line of attack to closer to off stump. Dilshan ends up hitting this back to the bowler as he looks for a forceful shot through the covers
136 kph, works with the angle to swivel and pull this straight to the boundary rider at backward square
133 kph, gets the line of this one horribly wrong as it slips down leg
133 kph, tucked away off the pads behind square for a straightforward single
134 kph, gets this to nip in from middle and off as Lahiru fails to get it away
138 kph, is late on this full delivery outside his off stump as the ball is sliced away to third man
137 kph, goes round the wicket to Dilshan now as he manages to nurdle Anderson for a single through the leg side
134 kph, picks the gap through midwicket with a clip as they are kept to a couple
136 kph, steers this fullish length away through the covers to keep the strike
135 kph, tucks away this back of a length off the hips as the pair scamper the first run hard to come back for two
138 kph, manages to get away Boult behind square on the off side as they rotate the strike

137 kph, struck firmly to the short cover fielder, who not only puts in the dive to stop the ball, but is able to fire in a throw at the striker's end as Dilshan returned back to his crease. Guptill was the fielder and he is deadly at that distance
138 kph, gets this one to curl in onto the pad outside leg as Dilshan is cramped for space
136 kph, on the back foot as this is worked away towards mid on
134 kph, opens the face to guide this length delivery outside off towards the third man region
134 kph, back of a length delivery on off. Thirimanne runs it down to third man
134 kph, full ball on middle and leg which is struck back at Anderson in his follow through
137 kph, gets nicely forward as this is parried away to the off side
135 kph, nicely behind the line of this ball
133 kph, has a flash at this fuller length which induces the outside edge as this flies over to the fielder at third man

137 kph, short of a length and Dilshan has to go as he offers up a feather of an edge which Ronchi takes gleefully from behind. Was looking to get down and bludgeon this through the line, but the extra bounce did him in. Big wicket for NZ as Dilshan has already reeled off two hundreds in the five matches prior
135 kph, Sangakkara able to get off the mark with a drive through the covers
128 kph, clipped away through midwicket as McClenaghan gets himself going here in Dunedin
134 kph, oversteps the mark as Lahiru works this one away behind square.

134 kph, and it doesn't come off for Sangakkara, althought a bit harsh as he has only been out there for a couple of balls. Ends up slamming this fuller length straight to the midwicket fielder, who takes the catch before dropping it

133 kph, McClenaghan strikes for his captain now as he removes Lahiru from the crease after the left-hander tickled one going down the leg side which Ronchi was wise to as he got into position quickly to take the catch low to his right. Almost spilled it too upon second viewing of the catch, but safe in the end
132 kph, sensibly allows this length ball going across him through to Ronchi as he gets himself in
133 kph, gets nicely behind the line of this length delivery going across

131 kph, this NZ team fields like a bunch of panthers as Mahela tries to force a drive on the up, with mid off running to his right before putting in the dive to catch the ball and hold it. Excellent stuff. NZ are looking a seriously good unit with the WC round the corner
133 kph, Sangakkara shows his class with a push to this fuller length which beats mid on to his right to find the boundary
133 kph, opens the face now to try and steer this past point, but to no avail
136 kph, guided away on the up through the covers as Mahela is brought on strike
134 kph, operating round the wicket now to Mahela as this is defended away
134 kph, gets nicely on top of the bounce as the ball rolls harmlessly to the off side
136 kph, length ball which just sat up for Mahela as he bludgeons this over cow corner to get off the mark with a boundary. Not really in control, but it is four runs all the same
steers this one softly to the leg side

goes down the track as the bounce ends up catching high on the splice of the bat to balloon temporarily over to the leg side, with McCullum sprinting hard to get to it, but unable to actually get under it
defended away by the batsman
tossed up and driven firmly by Sangakkara down to long on

gets this one to turn in from outside off as it seems to catch the top of Mahela's pad as the ball goes up in the air, with the slipper nearby putting in a good effort to take this. Given out straight away by the umpire, but Taylor immediately suggests that this may not have carried as he offers up a shrug to Vettori, who suddenly looks crestfallen. You can see a thick inside-edge on the bat, now it is all about whether Ross has taken this catch cleanly now. Not enough evidence for this to be given though as the angles on offer can't conclusively prove that Taylor did have his fingers under the ball. Taylor's honesty earns Mahela a reprieve.
turns this one away to the leg side for a quick single as the close-in fielder fires in a throw at the non-striker's, which just misses the stumps
133 kph, struck firmly to the man at mid off
123 kph, gets this fuller length wrong as he offers a full toss which seems to surprise Mahela as he just about manages to squirt it away
134 kph, fuller one just outside off and pushed uppishly by Kumar towards the silly mid off fielder
136 kph, content to just parry this length ball away to the off side
125 kph, fullish length just outside off which is directed more towards midwicket
125 kph, on top of the bounce as this is turned away to the leg side for one
Mahela looking to run Vettori past the slip, but finds the man in question

strikes him in line of the stumps as Vettori goes up for the appeal straightaway. Mahela is not convinced as he wants to review this one right away. Looks confident about his decision. There is indeed a deflection on the inside of the bat as it looks like he may have bottom-edged this one onto the pad. Mahela's good fortune considers as he survives yet another review. Sri Lankans all over the ground rejoice at the decision
sensibly defends this one away from the crease
gets added bounce as he opens the face
Mahela looking a touch tentative as he defends this with soft hands
picks his spot before chipping Vettori over extra-cover
132 kph, fullish length which is steered straight to long off
134 kph, predictable length from Anderson which Sangakkara gets under as he lofts this over long on to find the boundary
137 kph, waits on this just back of a length outside off before attempting to glide it past backward point, but the fielder is able to put the brakes on that
124 kph, tucks away Anderson through the leg side to rotate the strike

136 kph, fuller one outside off and Mahela is not three times lucky as he endeavours to chip Anderson over mid off, but ends up mishitting it as Brendon takes the simplest of catches. Big scalp that for NZ. Mahela furious with himself as he storms to the pavilion
140 kph, follows the line of this length ball angling in, doesn't make any contact though
eases this one down to long on to bring Dimuth on strike
advances down the track before adjusting his stroke at the last moment to steer this straight to Vettori
chops this one back towards Vettori, who picks it up in his follow through
nudged away off the pads now as Dimuth continues to look for the single
defended away on the front foot and with soft hands
gets deep in the crease before tucking this away off the back foot through square leg. Gets him off the mark as well
tosses one up on middle which is guided down to long on
given room outside his off stump to play the late cut as third man has to run to his right to field the ball
hangs on the back foot before pushing this to the left of Williamson who puts in a desperate dive, but can't cut it off
shifts his weight onto the back foot before pushing this down towards the same area
pinpoints the gap through backward square with a well-timed sweep that just races across the turf to the rope
full toss which Sangakkara cashes in on through neat footwork as this is carted away through cow corner for four
gets this one to spin perilously close past the outside edge of Dimuth's bat. Vettori putting on a clinic at the moment
waits on the back foot before tucking this away to the leg side
unable to get it past the silly mid on fielder
this time finds space on the leg side to sneak in a run
continues to operate a leg-stump line as this is clipped away just behind square
struck firmly on the up by the batsman as cow corner comes into play
flighted in on middle and off as this is guided down to long on by Dimuth
round the wicket to Sangakkara as this is dead-batted back to the bowler
shorter from Kane now as Kumar gets down the track before defending this straight to the close-in fielder on the leg side

Sangakkara waits deep in his crease before cutting this away powerfully through extra-cover, with Elliott putting in a dive just before the rope. Seemed to have saved two runs there, but he didn't make any contact with the ball and rope in tandem
executes a single through long on
manages to pickup a single square off the wicket on the off side
defended away in the general direction of mid off
able to glide one away just behind square to get off strike
nudged away off the back foot to the man at long on
rocks forward before working this one just to the right of short backward square
digs out this fuller one, but straight to the fielder at midwicket
picks up a single through long on to keep the strike

135 kph, able to punch this one away off the back foot just in front of square as Sangakkara looks to have made his ground at the other end before the direct hit. Ends up getting a few more as no one was backing up
134 kph, delivers one wide outside off which affords Sangakkara the opportunity to free his arms and cut this away through cover
140 kph, cut away fiercely to the point fielder, who is able to get behind it successfully
134 kph, gets good carry off the deck as Dimuth plays inside the line of this back of a length, looking to drive it on the up
131 kph, slanting in on the pads now as this is tucked away to deep midwicket for a brace
132 kph, driven to the off side by Dimuth to end the over
goes round the wicket to Kumar as this is defended away to the off side
picks up a single through deep square leg
is early on this length ball outside off as he fails to cut this away behind square
short of a length outside off and struck off the back foot towards the cover boundary
able to nudge this one away to the man at long on
slower delivery which is mishit in the direction of long on as Elliott's first over comes to a close
139 kph, looking to hit through the line of this length ball as it finishes up somewhere around deep midwicket
142 kph, Sangakkara fortunate to find the gap through backward point as he slices uppishly through that region to get four runs
136 kph, slapped away just in front of square on the off side
137 kph, whips away this fuller length outside his off stump through cow corner as the ball streaks away to the boundary rope. Useful boundary that for SL
134 kph, runs this back of a length ball down to third man for one

137 kph, where did that come from? Advances down the track to this length ball outside off before clobbering this over extra-cover for six. Moves to just one under fifty now. Has kept a good tempo in this innings thus far
fortunate to get away with this as he slices away a length ball just to the right of a diving Kane Williamson at backward point. Ends up finding the boundary, but the shot was fraught with danger
this time driven away in the region of extra-cover
able to rock back and pull this through midwicket to bring up his fifty. Continues to plunder on despite all the talks of a near retirement
able to just get it past Williamson once more at backward point to pickup the single
this time turned away off the hips towards towards square leg
punched back to the bowler off the back foot to end the over
134 kph, fullish and outside off, Sangakkara bends his left knee and goes for the drive, gets it off inside part back to the bowler
137 kph, flashes hard at this wide delivery, but doesn't quite middle it as sweeper cover mops up in the deep
135 kph, forced away off the back foot through the cover region
135 kph, glides this just back of a length delivery through the third man region

133 kph, Dimuth looking for the open space at midwicket as he tried to club this through the line, but the bat opened up at the last moment to offer up a top-edge which goes over to Mills at mid on, who takes it quite comfortably
136 kph, gets bat on this one, but ends up bottom-edging it to Luke Ronchi behind
spins in from outside off as this is parried away by the batsman off the back foot
defended with a nice, straight bat by Chandimal
this time looks to force the issue square off the wicket, but to no avail
worked away down to the fielder at long on
nurdled down to long on by Chandimal as they look to build a meaningful stand
able to steer this one past the close-in fielder on the leg side
126 kph, hits through the line to get this fuller one down to long on
129 kph, shoulders arms to this length ball outside his off stump
138 kph, able to get this away on the front foot through midwicket for a couple
135 kph, forced away off the pads to the leg side, but can't locate any space
138 kph, sheer class from Chandimal as he merely pushes at this fuller length, with the ball just racing away through long on to find the boundary
141 kph, rocks forward before angling this one away through the mid on region
nurdled off the back foot with soft hands
looks to employ the sweep but doesn't quite time it away

oh no! What has happened? Chandimal calls for a quick single to the off side as he plays with soft hands. Kumar is intent on following through with the call, but sees the danger coming from the off side as the fielder picks up and fires in a throw to Ronchi. Sends Chandimal back, but he reacts too late as he is not even in the picture when the bails are whisked off by the keeper. Sangakkara apologises to him,but it won't prevent them from losing another key wicket as this chase gets into the business end
defended from the crease as he reaches out to this Vettori delivery
tries to pickup a single on the leg side, but the close-in fielder quickly dissuades that thought from the batsman's mind
once again looking to help it round the corner, but doesn't get it away where he would have liked
135 kph, glances away this leg-side delivery on the pads to deep square leg
137 kph, rides the bounce nicely to punch this through the covers for one
138 kph, opens the face a touch to try and run this past gully, but doesn't come off quite to plan
134 kph, fuller delivery on the pads which is clipped away by Mendis to get him going here in Dunedin
135 kph, fullish length outside off and square driven as sweeper cover comes round to field
123 kph, reaches out to defend this one on the front foot as the ball rolls harmlessly to the off side
lofts one high over long on to get Mendis on strike
continues to operate the leg-stump line as this is tucked away behind square
played with soft hands and from the crease as Ronchi collects the ball after
shifts the line closer to middle and leg as this is worked down to long on
fended away with soft hands to the off side for one

this is just poor running from Mendis. Breakdown in communication with Sangakkara as this one is cut away to extra-cover, with the batsman looking to complete two before he sees his partner not reacting at the other end. Mendis turns on the spot, and puts in the dive, but comically lands about a metre short of his crease as he falls flat on the ground. Tries to get his bat across, but crucially lets go off the handle. The throw, which was initially fired in at the wrong end, is quickly dispatched by the bowler to Ronchi, who whips off the bails as Mendis lies on the ground, wondering about better days
125 kph, needled down towards long off to bring the new batsman, Thisara Perera, on strike
136 kph, steered by Perera down to deep extra-cover to get off the mark
short of length delivery just outside off, Perera looks to cut and gets beaten
136 kph, defends just inside the line of this length ball outside off

135 kph, Anderson strikes Perera right in front as the umpire goes straight up with the finger. Sangakkara urges his partner to go for the review regardless. HotSpot shows no deflection, and the ball looks to have struck on the knee roll. Only question is whether this one hit in line. Ends up being ruled as out as the impact is umpire's call. The gamble fails to come off for SL as Perera exists without too much fuss
141 kph, once again into the thick of things with another one which strikes the pads, but this looks like it struck outside off
129 kph, short of a length which Kumar tries to get through gully, but finds the fielder
135 kph, hangs on the back foot to work this one away through the leg side. Brings Prasad on strike
133 kph, survives his first test as this length ball goes across him, with Prasad defending it away
136 kph, moves a touch to his off stump to turn this length delivery on middle away behind square to get one to his name
133 kph, cut away through backward point as Sangakkara looks to shepherd the strike
133 kph, Prasad does his duty well in keeping out this length ball going across him
125 kph, Sangakkara throws caution to the wind as he attacks this length ball, lifting Anderson high over long off for six
138 kph, slips in the yorker this time which Sangakkara is equal to
128 kph, tries to force one away off the back foot square off the wicket
137 kph, this time steers Anderson down to long on
138 kph, looking to stand his ground and heave Anderson through extra-cover, but is late on the ball as it goes across
118 kph, this time delivers a slower ball in the same channel as Prasad is now early on it, with the same result carried out in the end
141 kph, fuller one which is defended on the front foot by Sangakkara
117 kph, Sangakkara well late on this slower ball yorker as he gets an inside-edge which takes the ball away from the stumps and through fine leg for a fortuitous boundary
133 kph, this time goes wide of third man with an uppish slice that beats the boundary rider to the rope

135 kph, and Boult has landed the Big Kahuna as Sangakkara, forced at this point to deal with an escalating required rate, ends up getting a leading edge to this one he looked to flick behind square, with the ball spooning up to mid on, who takes the catch comfortably. That could be the final death blow for Sri Lanka, despite having the two wickets still in hand. But you know cricket, it is never over till the fat lady sings!
137 kph, able to just about get away this back of a length through the leg side
139 kph, slips one down the leg side now as this is flicked away efficiently to deep fine leg
128 kph, strikes Prasad just above the knee roll as he puts in a hopeful shout, but the umpire remains nonplussed
133 kph, delivers one on middle and leg as Prasad deflects it away
131 kph, is well late on this length ball going across him
131 kph, gets onto the back foot before working this one away through mid off
134 kph, tries to guide one away square off the wicket, but doesn't quite middle it

133 kph, NZ have to be the best fielding outfit going around! Another brilliant run-out effected, this time by Mills as he makes a late decision to throw at the non-striker's after there was a mix-up in the middle between the two. Prasad ends up trying to get down to the other end, but is short of his crease when the throw hits the stumps. Nine down now SL and it looks all but over in Dunedin
126 kph, deliberated whether to go after this one outside his off stump, but decides against it
126 kph, pulls the bowler straight past him to find the long on fielder
128 kph, is well late on this fuller one going across him as he looks to caress this through the covers
128 kph, another play-and-a-miss from Herath as he is late again on this fullish ball
130 kph, pitches it up a bit further as Herath seems to be stuck in an infinite loop
127 kph, gets a bottom-edge to this attempted pull through midwicket, but the ball ends up falling short of Ronchi as he went after it
135 kph, brings the hammer down as this is fended away to the off side
135 kph, picks up this length ball on middle and leg and lifts it high over cow corner, but not enough to beat a chasing McCullum, who puts in a splendid dive before the rope to save the run
129 kph, slips in the bouncer which is well over Lakmal's head as the umpire signals to the scorer

and Guptill ends it all after Lakmal goes after this back of a length, looking to cart it over midwicket, but gets a top-edge which flies right over the wicket, with Guptill taking the catch just over the non-striker's end
